      private void addShipToPlayground(IShip ship)
      Help method to add an ship to the playground, as loading exists, it is necessary to check if it is hit
      void buildPlayground()
      This method builds the Playground, if there are no Ships in the ShipList, it will create an playground filled all Fields with water If there are Ships in the List it will place them as shipParts Creates the Playground, sets all ships-parts on the Field (if it is the own Field) and fills the rest of the fields with water
      private void checkIfNextToShip(java.util.ArrayList<Point> surroundingCoordinates, java.util.ArrayList<Point> changedCoordinates)
      When a surroundingCoordinates is not next to a ship is sets the ValidPlacementMarker to true
      private java.util.ArrayList<Point> checkSurroundingsOfMarkedPositions(Point[] coordinates)
      Calculates the surrounding Coordinates of a Point This method calls foreach surrounding coordinate the checkIfNextToShip method

      • shoot

        public ShotResponse shoot(Point pos_shot)
        Use this method when the enemy shoots at our playground Manages all necessary actions, when and shot occurs on our playground
        Specified by:
        shoot in interface IOwnPlayground
        Parameters:
        pos_shot - The position, where the enemy wants to hit our playground
        Returns:
        Returns an ShotResponseObject containing three booleans: gameLost: True if the game is over, because we lost all our ships hit: True one of our ships got hit shipDestroyed: True, if on of our ships got hit and got destroyed

      • buildPlayground

        public void buildPlayground()
        This method builds the Playground, if there are no Ships in the ShipList, it will create an playground filled all Fields with water If there are Ships in the List it will place them as shipParts Creates the Playground, sets all ships-parts on the Field (if it is the own Field) and fills the rest of the fields with water
        Specified by:
        buildPlayground in interface IPlayground
        Specified by:
        buildPlayground in class AbstractPlayground

      • isValidPlacement

        public boolean isValidPlacement(Point startPoint,
                                Point endPoint)
        This method only checks whether the ship (represented by start and endpoint) can be placed or not In both cases no ship is created
        Specified by:
        isValidPlacement in interface IOwnPlayground
        Parameters:
        startPoint - The start point of the ship
        endPoint - The end point of the ship
        Returns:
        true, if placement is allowed

      • isShipPlacementValid

        public IShip isShipPlacementValid(Point startPoint,
                                  Point endPoint)
        Checks if the ship represented by these two points is valid if the ship placement is valid the method creates the ship and adds it to the shipList itself
        Specified by:
        isShipPlacementValid in interface IOwnPlayground
        Parameters:
        startPoint - The start point of the ship, which needs to be checked
        endPoint - The end point of the ship, which needs to be checked
        Returns:
        The ship if the placement is valid. In any other case null

      • moveShip

        public IShip moveShip(IShip shipToMove,
                      Point newStartPoint,
                      Point newEndpoint)
        Use this method, when the player wants to switch the position of his ship on the selection
        Specified by:
        moveShip in interface IOwnPlayground
        Parameters:
        shipToMove - The current ship the player wants to move to another position
        newStartPoint - The startPosition, where the player wants to move the ship
        newEndpoint - The endPosition, where the player wants to move the ship
        Returns:
        IShip, if the ship movement was correct, null if the movement is not allowed

      • checkSurroundingsOfMarkedPositions

        private java.util.ArrayList<Point> checkSurroundingsOfMarkedPositions(Point[] coordinates)
        Calculates the surrounding Coordinates of a Point This method calls foreach surrounding coordinate the checkIfNextToShip method
        Parameters:
        coordinates - The coordinates of the ship
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Points with changed coordinates

        Parameters:
